p: Furthermore, the molecular docking study could also be helpful in determining the AChE inhibitory potential of a compound or essential oil. Autodock 4.2 and iGemDock 2.1 software were employed to find out the affinity of isolated essential oil from Myrciaria floribunda (H. Westex Wild) for AD target protein AChE. The oil exhibited the AChE inhibitory potential with IC 50 = 0.08 μg/mL, and this activity is attributed to the higher binding affinity of δ-cadinene and γ-cadinene (oil constituents) toward AChE as predicted by the docking score of –7.35 and –6.77, respectively [ 97].
